column4: I'm currently running windows xp and trying to install Ubuntu 7.04 from a disk I was mailed.  When I boot from the disk I run the option Start or Install Ubuntu but it doesn't install.  Instead it tells me that a graphical interface could not be started and just starts a command line terminal.  Is this because there's some other Ubuntu on my system from a way back(I don't believe there is)?
It means it is unable to properly detect your video card or monitor. 7.04 is no longer supported though, you should download or order 8.04 or 9.10 from www.ubuntu.com
Ordering a CD is completely free btw, Canonical pays the shipping fee.
Oh I know - it's just a time thing.  Thanks to both of you though, you saved me anymore rebooting headaches.
